messages.content: What is the purpose of the Image Randomizer node in ComfyUI_Fill-Nodes?

The Image Randomizer node in ComfyUI_Fill-Nodes allows you to pull images either in sequence or at random from a directory. It uses a dummy int value attached to a seed to ensure it continues to pull new images even if the seed is fixed.
How can the Image Captioning saver node in ComfyUI_Fill-Nodes be used?

The Image Captioning saver node in ComfyUI_Fill-Nodes takes an input image and saves a matching .txt file with the image containing the desired caption. It can be used to save Lora captions from a Dataset Creator.
What does the Dimension Display node in ComfyUI_Fill-Nodes do?
The Dimension Display node in ComfyUI_Fill-Nodes simply shows the dimensions of an image in a string for monitoring purposes, without the need for INTS.
How does the Pixelator node in ComfyUI_Fill-Nodes affect an image?
The Pixelator node in ComfyUI_Fill-Nodes is a custom effect that bit reduces an image and makes it black and white.
What functionality does the Audio Tools node in ComfyUI_Fill-Nodes provide?
The Audio Tools node in ComfyUI_Fill-Nodes allows you to load audio, scan for BPM, and crop audio to desired bars and duration. It is a work in progress.
What is the purpose of the Directory Crawler node in ComfyUI_Fill-Nodes?
The Directory Crawler node in ComfyUI_Fill-Nodes is a simple node that loads all images in a directory and any subdirectories as well.
How can the Raw Code Node in ComfyUI_Fill-Nodes be useful for development?

The Raw Code Node in ComfyUI_Fill-Nodes loads Python and allows you to develop inside ComfyUI without having to reload the instance every time, making it great for developing ideas and writing custom code quickly.
